snippet: A new generation of Latino leaders — highly educated, sophisticated and rich — is tapping into Hispanics as a fund-raising pool to influence elections and policy.
abstract: New generation of Latino leaders--highly educated, sophisticated and rich--is tapping into Hispanics as a fund-raising pool to influence elections and public policy; on frontier of this movement are Obama donors Henry R Munoz III, Andres W Lopez and Eva Longora, founders of the Futuro Fund, which raised $32 million by soliciting fellow Latinos; these donors vow to give voice to Hispanics on a variety of issues.
lead_paragraph: A new generation of Latino leaders — highly educated, sophisticated and rich — is tapping into Hispanics as a fund-raising pool to influence elections and policy.

headline.main: Latinos Gain Political Muscle, and Fund-Raisers Show How
headline.print_headline: Latinos Gain Political Muscle, And Fund-Raisers Show How
